Description: Conical foot sherd of large Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black with trace of two bands in added colour (now lost); reserved edge of foot and underside; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The thickness of the sherd suggests that it belongs to a large vessel like a heavy chalice. Chalice kraters are found in the Mature Animal Style and Grand Style. The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.387.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1616) (phase 2)
